1‚Üí# Add React Error Boundary for graceful crash recovery
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWrap the application's route tree in a React Error Boundary component that catches JavaScript runtime errors and displays a user-friendly fallback UI with a recovery action, instead of showing a blank white screen.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Rationale
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíThe app has zero Error Boundary components (confirmed by searching for 'ErrorBoundary' across the entire frontend src). If any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing a property on undefined data, a rendering bug), React unmounts the entire component tree and the user sees a blank white page with no way to recover except a full browser refresh. For a construction operations platform used on job sites, this is especially problematic.
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí---
    12‚Üí*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13‚Üí

    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return <Outlet />
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí

    27‚Üí    <Routes>

    42‚Üí              <Route path="contacts" element={<ContactsPage />} />

1‚Üíimport React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, useMemo } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport { ThemeProvider as MuiThemeProvider } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3‚Üíimport CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline'
     4‚Üíimport { createLightTheme, createDarkTheme } from './theme'
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üítype ThemeMode = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíinterface ThemeContextType {
     9‚Üí  mode: ThemeMode
    10‚Üí  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void
    11‚Üí  isDark: boolean
    12‚Üí  toggleTheme: () => void
    13‚Üí}
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíconst ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üíexport function useThemeMode() {
    18‚Üí  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)
    19‚Üí  if (!context) {
    20‚Üí    throw new Error('useThemeMode must be used within ThemeProvider')
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return context
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíinterface ThemeProviderProps {
    26‚Üí  children: React.ReactNode
    27‚Üí}
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport function ThemeProvider({ children }: ThemeProviderProps) {
    30‚Üí  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>(() => {
    31‚Üí    const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme-mode')
    32‚Üí    return (stored as ThemeMode) || 'system'
    33‚Üí  })
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí  const [systemPrefersDark, setSystemPrefersDark] = useState(() =>
    36‚Üí    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
    37‚Üí  )
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    40‚Üí    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')
    41‚Üí    const handler = (e: MediaQueryListEvent) => setSystemPrefersDark(e.matches)
    42‚Üí    mediaQuery.addEventListener('change', handler)
    43‚Üí    return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener('change', handler)
    44‚Üí  }, [])
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    47‚Üí    localStorage.setItem('theme-mode', mode)
    48‚Üí  }, [mode])
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  const isDark = useMemo(() => {
    51‚Üí    if (mode === 'system') return systemPrefersDark
    52‚Üí    return mode === 'dark'
    53‚Üí  }, [mode, systemPrefersDark])
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí  const theme = useMemo(() => {
    56‚Üí    return isDark ? createDarkTheme() : createLightTheme()
    57‚Üí  }, [isDark])
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí  const toggleTheme = () => {
    60‚Üí    setMode(prev => {
    61‚Üí      if (prev === 'light') return 'dark'
    62‚Üí      if (prev === 'dark') return 'light'
    63‚Üí      return isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'
    64‚Üí    })
    65‚Üí  }
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí  const value = useMemo(() => ({
    68‚Üí    mode,
    69‚Üí    setMode,
    70‚Üí    isDark,
    71‚Üí    toggleTheme,
    72‚Üí  }), [mode, isDark])
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí  return (
    75‚Üí    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
    76‚Üí      <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    77‚Üí        <CssBaseline />
    78‚Üí        {children}
    79‚Üí      </MuiThemeProvider>
    80‚Üí    </ThemeContext.Provider>
    81‚Üí  )
    82‚Üí}
    83‚Üí

1‚Üíimport { createContext, useContext, useState, useCallback, ReactNode } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport Snackbar from '@mui/material/Snackbar'
     3‚Üíimport Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üítype ToastSeverity = 'success' | 'error' | 'warning' | 'info'
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíinterface ToastContextType {
     8‚Üí  showToast: (message: string, severity?: ToastSeverity) => void
     9‚Üí  showError: (message: string) => void
    10‚Üí  showSuccess: (message: string) => void
    11‚Üí  showInfo: (message: string) => void
    12‚Üí  showWarning: (message: string) => void
    13‚Üí}
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíconst ToastContext = createContext<ToastContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üíexport function useToast() {
    18‚Üí  const context = useContext(ToastContext)
    19‚Üí  if (!context) {
    20‚Üí    throw new Error('useToast must be used within a ToastProvider')
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return context
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíinterface ToastProviderProps {
    26‚Üí  children: ReactNode
    27‚Üí}
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport function ToastProvider({ children }: ToastProviderProps) {
    30‚Üí  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false)
    31‚Üí  const [message, setMessage] = useState('')
    32‚Üí  const [severity, setSeverity] = useState<ToastSeverity>('info')
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí  const showToast = useCallback((msg: string, sev: ToastSeverity = 'info') => {
    35‚Üí    setMessage(msg)
    36‚Üí    setSeverity(sev)
    37‚Üí    setOpen(true)
    38‚Üí  }, [])
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí  const showError = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    41‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'error')
    42‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí  const showSuccess = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    45‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'success')
    46‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí  const showInfo = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    49‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'info')
    50‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí  const showWarning = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    53‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'warning')
    54‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí  const handleClose = () => {
    57‚Üí    setOpen(false)
    58‚Üí  }
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí  return (
    61‚Üí    <ToastContext.Provider value={{ showToast, showError, showSuccess, showInfo, showWarning }}>
    62‚Üí      {children}
    63‚Üí      <Snackbar
    64‚Üí        open={open}
    65‚Üí        autoHideDuration={5000}
    66‚Üí        onClose={handleClose}
    67‚Üí        anchorOrigin={{ vertical: 'bottom', horizontal: 'right' }}
    68‚Üí      >
    69‚Üí        <Alert onClose={handleClose} severity={severity} variant="filled" sx={{ width: '100%' }}>
    70‚Üí          {message}
    71‚Üí        </Alert>
    72‚Üí      </Snackbar>
    73‚Üí    </ToastContext.Provider>
    74‚Üí  )
    75‚Üí}
    76‚Üí

entries.content:
Perfect! I've completed my investigation. Now let me document my findings and create the implementation plan.

## INVESTIGATION FINDINGS

**Existing Patterns Found:**
1. **Provider Pattern**: Custom context providers with hooks (ThemeProvider, ToastProvider)
2. **Material-UI**: Comprehensive MUI component library in use (Alert, Snackbar, Button, etc.)
3. **React Router v6**: Nested route structure with ProtectedRoute wrapper
4. **Error Handling**: Axios interceptors handle 401 errors, but NO React Error Boundaries exist
5. **Toast System**: Already available via ToastProvider for user notifications

**Relevant Files:**
- `frontend/src/main.tsx` - Entry point (wraps App with providers)
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Routes definition
- `frontend/src/components/common/ToastProvider.tsx` - Provider pattern reference
- `frontend/src/theme/ThemeContext.tsx` - Context pattern reference

**Tech Stack:**
- React 18.2.0 (full Error Boundary support)
- TypeScript 5.3.3
- Material-UI 5.15.6
- React Router v6.21.3
- Vite build tool

**Conventions:**
- Named exports for components/hooks
- TypeScript interfaces for all props
- Functional components with hooks (but Error Boundaries require class components or use react-error-boundary library)
- Custom hooks throw errors if used outside provider

## PHASE 1: UPDATE CONTEXT FILES

entries.content:
---

## ‚úÖ PLANNING SESSION COMPLETE

I've successfully completed the planning phase for adding a React Error Boundary to the application. Here's what was created:

### üìã Investigation Summary

**Current State:**
- ‚úÖ Confirmed: **ZERO** Error Boundary components exist in the codebase
- ‚úÖ React 18.2.0 with full Error Boundary support
- ‚úÖ Material-UI 5.15.6 available for fallback UI
- ‚úÖ Entry point identified: `frontend/src/main.tsx`
- ‚úÖ Provider patterns documented: ThemeProvider, ToastProvider

**Problem:**
When any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing undefined properties, rendering bugs), React unmounts the entire tree and the user sees a blank white screen with no recovery option except browser refresh.

### üìù Implementation Plan Created

**Workflow Type:** `simple` (single-service, straightforward task)

**2 Phases, 3 Subtasks:**

**Phase 1: Create Error Boundary Component**
- Subtask 1-1: Create `ErrorBoundary.tsx` component
  - Class component with `componentDidCatch` and `getDerivedStateFromError`
  - Fallback UI using Material-UI (Alert, Typography, Button)
  - Reload button for recovery
  - Show error details in development mode only

**Phase 2: Integration and Verification**
- Subtask 2-1: Wrap App with ErrorBoundary in `main.tsx`
  - Provider hierarchy: BrowserRouter > ThemeProvider > ToastProvider > **ErrorBoundary** > App
  
- Subtask 2-2: Manual verification
  - Test with temporary error-throwing component
  - Verify fallback UI displays correctly
  - Verify reload button recovers the app

### üìÅ Files Created

```
.auto-claude/specs/136-add-react-error-boundary-for-graceful-crash-recove/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ context.json              (2.1 KB) - Investigation findings & patterns
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ implementation_plan.json  (7.4 KB) - Detailed subtask-based plan
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ init.sh                   (1.9 KB) - Frontend dev server startup
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ build-progress.txt        (2.8 KB) - Session 1 progress notes
```

### üéØ Verification Strategy

- **Risk Level:** Low (UI-only change, standard React pattern)
- **Required Tests:** Manual browser testing
- **Build Check:** TypeScript compilation must succeed
- **No automated tests needed** for this simple component

### üöÄ Next Steps

A **separate coder agent** will implement the subtasks by running:

```bash
cd frontend && npm run dev:hmr
```

Or using the init script:

```bash
./.auto-claude/specs/136-add-react-error-boundary-for-graceful-crash-recove/init.sh
```

### üìä Key Decisions

1. **Class Component:** Error Boundaries require class components (or react-error-boundary library)
2. **Placement:** Wrap after ToastProvider to ensure error notifications still work
3. **Fallback UI:** Material-UI components for consistency with existing design system
4. **Recovery:** Simple page reload via `window.location.reload()`
5. **Error Details:** Only show in development mode for debugging

---

**‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT:** My role as Planner Agent is complete. I have **NOT** implemented any code. The implementation will be done by a separate coder agent in the next session.

All planning files are **local only** (gitignored) and managed by the orchestrator. Only code changes will be committed to git.
I'll implement this subtask step by step. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the necessary files.

1‚Üí# Add React Error Boundary for graceful crash recovery
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWrap the application's route tree in a React Error Boundary component that catches JavaScript runtime errors and displays a user-friendly fallback UI with a recovery action, instead of showing a blank white screen.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Rationale
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíThe app has zero Error Boundary components (confirmed by searching for 'ErrorBoundary' across the entire frontend src). If any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing a property on undefined data, a rendering bug), React unmounts the entire component tree and the user sees a blank white page with no way to recover except a full browser refresh. For a construction operations platform used on job sites, this is especially problematic.
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí---
    12‚Üí*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13‚Üí

1‚Üíimport { createContext, useContext, useState, useCallback, ReactNode } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport Snackbar from '@mui/material/Snackbar'
     3‚Üíimport Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üítype ToastSeverity = 'success' | 'error' | 'warning' | 'info'
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíinterface ToastContextType {
     8‚Üí  showToast: (message: string, severity?: ToastSeverity) => void
     9‚Üí  showError: (message: string) => void
    10‚Üí  showSuccess: (message: string) => void
    11‚Üí  showInfo: (message: string) => void
    12‚Üí  showWarning: (message: string) => void
    13‚Üí}
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíconst ToastContext = createContext<ToastContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üíexport function useToast() {
    18‚Üí  const context = useContext(ToastContext)
    19‚Üí  if (!context) {
    20‚Üí    throw new Error('useToast must be used within a ToastProvider')
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return context
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíinterface ToastProviderProps {
    26‚Üí  children: ReactNode
    27‚Üí}
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport function ToastProvider({ children }: ToastProviderProps) {
    30‚Üí  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false)
    31‚Üí  const [message, setMessage] = useState('')
    32‚Üí  const [severity, setSeverity] = useState<ToastSeverity>('info')
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí  const showToast = useCallback((msg: string, sev: ToastSeverity = 'info') => {
    35‚Üí    setMessage(msg)
    36‚Üí    setSeverity(sev)
    37‚Üí    setOpen(true)
    38‚Üí  }, [])
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí  const showError = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    41‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'error')
    42‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí  const showSuccess = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    45‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'success')
    46‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí  const showInfo = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    49‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'info')
    50‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí  const showWarning = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    53‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'warning')
    54‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí  const handleClose = () => {
    57‚Üí    setOpen(false)
    58‚Üí  }
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí  return (
    61‚Üí    <ToastContext.Provider value={{ showToast, showError, showSuccess, showInfo, showWarning }}>
    62‚Üí      {children}
    63‚Üí      <Snackbar
    64‚Üí        open={open}
    65‚Üí        autoHideDuration={5000}
    66‚Üí        onClose={handleClose}
    67‚Üí        anchorOrigin={{ vertical: 'bottom', horizontal: 'right' }}
    68‚Üí      >
    69‚Üí        <Alert onClose={handleClose} severity={severity} variant="filled" sx={{ width: '100%' }}>
    70‚Üí          {message}
    71‚Üí        </Alert>
    72‚Üí      </Snackbar>
    73‚Üí    </ToastContext.Provider>
    74‚Üí  )
    75‚Üí}
    76‚Üí

1‚Üíimport React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, useMemo } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport { ThemeProvider as MuiThemeProvider } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3‚Üíimport CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline'
     4‚Üíimport { createLightTheme, createDarkTheme } from './theme'
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üítype ThemeMode = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíinterface ThemeContextType {
     9‚Üí  mode: ThemeMode
    10‚Üí  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void
    11‚Üí  isDark: boolean
    12‚Üí  toggleTheme: () => void
    13‚Üí}
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíconst ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üíexport function useThemeMode() {
    18‚Üí  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)
    19‚Üí  if (!context) {
    20‚Üí    throw new Error('useThemeMode must be used within ThemeProvider')
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return context
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíinterface ThemeProviderProps {
    26‚Üí  children: React.ReactNode
    27‚Üí}
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport function ThemeProvider({ children }: ThemeProviderProps) {
    30‚Üí  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>(() => {
    31‚Üí    const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme-mode')
    32‚Üí    return (stored as ThemeMode) || 'system'
    33‚Üí  })
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí  const [systemPrefersDark, setSystemPrefersDark] = useState(() =>
    36‚Üí    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
    37‚Üí  )
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    40‚Üí    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')
    41‚Üí    const handler = (e: MediaQueryListEvent) => setSystemPrefersDark(e.matches)
    42‚Üí    mediaQuery.addEventListener('change', handler)
    43‚Üí    return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener('change', handler)
    44‚Üí  }, [])
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    47‚Üí    localStorage.setItem('theme-mode', mode)
    48‚Üí  }, [mode])
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  const isDark = useMemo(() => {
    51‚Üí    if (mode === 'system') return systemPrefersDark
    52‚Üí    return mode === 'dark'
    53‚Üí  }, [mode, systemPrefersDark])
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí  const theme = useMemo(() => {
    56‚Üí    return isDark ? createDarkTheme() : createLightTheme()
    57‚Üí  }, [isDark])
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí  const toggleTheme = () => {
    60‚Üí    setMode(prev => {
    61‚Üí      if (prev === 'light') return 'dark'
    62‚Üí      if (prev === 'dark') return 'light'
    63‚Üí      return isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'
    64‚Üí    })
    65‚Üí  }
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí  const value = useMemo(() => ({
    68‚Üí    mode,
    69‚Üí    setMode,
    70‚Üí    isDark,
    71‚Üí    toggleTheme,
    72‚Üí  }), [mode, isDark])
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí  return (
    75‚Üí    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
    76‚Üí      <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    77‚Üí        <CssBaseline />
    78‚Üí        {children}
    79‚Üí      </MuiThemeProvider>
    80‚Üí    </ThemeContext.Provider>
    81‚Üí  )
    82‚Üí}

entries.detail:
1‚Üí# Add React Error Boundary for graceful crash recovery
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWrap the application's route tree in a React Error Boundary component that catches JavaScript runtime errors and displays a user-friendly fallback UI with a recovery action, instead of showing a blank white screen.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Rationale
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíThe app has zero Error Boundary components (confirmed by searching for 'ErrorBoundary' across the entire frontend src). If any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing a property on undefined data, a rendering bug), React unmounts the entire component tree and the user sees a blank white page with no way to recover except a full browser refresh. For a construction operations platform used on job sites, this is especially problematic.
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí---
    12‚Üí*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13‚Üí

1‚Üíimport React, { Component, ErrorInfo, ReactNode } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     3‚Üíimport Container from '@mui/material/Container'
     4‚Üíimport Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
     5‚Üíimport Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
     6‚Üíimport Button from '@mui/material/Button'
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíinterface ErrorBoundaryProps {
     9‚Üí  children: ReactNode
    10‚Üí  fallback?: ReactNode
    11‚Üí}
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üíinterface ErrorBoundaryState {
    14‚Üí  hasError: boolean
    15‚Üí  error: Error | null
    16‚Üí  errorInfo: ErrorInfo | null
    17‚Üí}
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üíexport class ErrorBoundary extends Component<ErrorBoundaryProps, ErrorBoundaryState> {
    20‚Üí  constructor(props: ErrorBoundaryProps) {
    21‚Üí    super(props)
    22‚Üí    this.state = {
    23‚Üí      hasError: false,
    24‚Üí      error: null,
    25‚Üí      errorInfo: null,
    26‚Üí    }
    27‚Üí  }
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí  static getDerivedStateFromError(error: Error): Partial<ErrorBoundaryState> {
    30‚Üí    return {
    31‚Üí      hasError: true,
    32‚Üí      error,
    33‚Üí    }
    34‚Üí  }
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí  componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: ErrorInfo): void {
    37‚Üí    this.setState({
    38‚Üí      error,
    39‚Üí      errorInfo,
    40‚Üí    })
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí    // Log error to console for debugging
    43‚Üí    console.error('ErrorBoundary caught an error:', error, errorInfo)
    44‚Üí  }
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí  handleReload = (): void => {
    47‚Üí    window.location.reload()
    48‚Üí  }
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  render(): ReactNode {
    51‚Üí    if (this.state.hasError) {
    52‚Üí      if (this.props.fallback) {
    53‚Üí        return this.props.fallback
    54‚Üí      }
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí      const isDevelopment = import.meta.env.DEV
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí      return (
    59‚Üí        <Box
    60‚Üí          sx={{
    61‚Üí            display: 'flex',
    62‚Üí            alignItems: 'center',
    63‚Üí            justifyContent: 'center',
    64‚Üí            minHeight: '100vh',
    65‚Üí            bgcolor: 'background.default',
    66‚Üí          }}
    67‚Üí        >
    68‚Üí          <Container maxWidth="md">
    69‚Üí            <Alert severity="error" sx={{ mb: 3 }}>
    70‚Üí              <Typography variant="h6" gutterBottom>
    71‚Üí                Something went wrong
    72‚Üí              </Typography>
    73‚Üí              <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ mb: 2 }}>
    74‚Üí                An unexpected error occurred in the application. Please try reloading the page.
    75‚Üí              </Typography>
    76‚Üí              {isDevelopment && this.state.error && (
    77‚Üí                <Box sx={{ mt: 2 }}>
    78‚Üí                  <Typography variant="subtitle2" sx={{ fontWeight: 'bold', mb: 1 }}>
    79‚Üí                    Error Details (Development Only):
    80‚Üí                  </Typography>
    81‚Üí                  <Typography
    82‚Üí                    variant="body2"
    83‚Üí                    component="pre"
    84‚Üí                    sx={{
    85‚Üí                      p: 2,
    86‚Üí                      bgcolor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
    87‚Üí                      borderRadius: 1,
    88‚Üí                      overflow: 'auto',
    89‚Üí                      fontSize: '0.875rem',
    90‚Üí                      fontFamily: 'monospace',
    91‚Üí                    }}
    92‚Üí                  >
    93‚Üí                    {this.state.error.message}
    94‚Üí                  </Typography>
    95‚Üí                  {this.state.errorInfo?.componentStack && (
    96‚Üí                    <Typography
    97‚Üí                      variant="body2"
    98‚Üí                      component="pre"
    99‚Üí                      sx={{
   100‚Üí                        mt: 1,
   101‚Üí                        p: 2,
   102‚Üí                        bgcolor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
   103‚Üí                        borderRadius: 1,
   104‚Üí                        overflow: 'auto',
   105‚Üí                        fontSize: '0.75rem',
   106‚Üí                        fontFamily: 'monospace',
   107‚Üí                        maxHeight: '200px',
   108‚Üí                      }}
   109‚Üí                    >
   110‚Üí                      {this.state.errorInfo.componentStack}
   111‚Üí                    </Typography>
   112‚Üí                  )}
   113‚Üí                </Box>
   114‚Üí              )}
   115‚Üí              <Button
   116‚Üí                variant="contained"
   117‚Üí                color="primary"
   118‚Üí                onClick={this.handleReload}
   119‚Üí                sx={{ mt: 2 }}
   120‚Üí              >
   121‚Üí                Reload Page
   122‚Üí              </Button>
   123‚Üí            </Alert>
   124‚Üí          </Container>
   125‚Üí        </Box>
   126‚Üí      )
   127‚Üí    }
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí    return this.props.children
   130‚Üí  }
   131‚Üí}

1‚Üí# Add React Error Boundary for graceful crash recovery
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWrap the application's route tree in a React Error Boundary component that catches JavaScript runtime errors and displays a user-friendly fallback UI with a recovery action, instead of showing a blank white screen.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Rationale
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíThe app has zero Error Boundary components (confirmed by searching for 'ErrorBoundary' across the entire frontend src). If any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing a property on undefined data, a rendering bug), React unmounts the entire component tree and the user sees a blank white page with no way to recover except a full browser refresh. For a construction operations platform used on job sites, this is especially problematic.
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí---
    12‚Üí*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13‚Üí

1‚Üíimport React, { Component, ErrorInfo, ReactNode } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport Box from '@mui/material/Box'
     3‚Üíimport Container from '@mui/material/Container'
     4‚Üíimport Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
     5‚Üíimport Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
     6‚Üíimport Button from '@mui/material/Button'
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíinterface ErrorBoundaryProps {
     9‚Üí  children: ReactNode
    10‚Üí  fallback?: ReactNode
    11‚Üí}
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üíinterface ErrorBoundaryState {
    14‚Üí  hasError: boolean
    15‚Üí  error: Error | null
    16‚Üí  errorInfo: ErrorInfo | null
    17‚Üí}
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üíexport class ErrorBoundary extends Component<ErrorBoundaryProps, ErrorBoundaryState> {
    20‚Üí  constructor(props: ErrorBoundaryProps) {
    21‚Üí    super(props)
    22‚Üí    this.state = {
    23‚Üí      hasError: false,
    24‚Üí      error: null,
    25‚Üí      errorInfo: null,
    26‚Üí    }
    27‚Üí  }
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí  static getDerivedStateFromError(error: Error): Partial<ErrorBoundaryState> {
    30‚Üí    return {
    31‚Üí      hasError: true,
    32‚Üí      error,
    33‚Üí    }
    34‚Üí  }
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí  componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: ErrorInfo): void {
    37‚Üí    this.setState({
    38‚Üí      error,
    39‚Üí      errorInfo,
    40‚Üí    })
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí    // Log error to console for debugging
    43‚Üí    console.error('ErrorBoundary caught an error:', error, errorInfo)
    44‚Üí  }
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí  handleReload = (): void => {
    47‚Üí    window.location.reload()
    48‚Üí  }
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  render(): ReactNode {
    51‚Üí    if (this.state.hasError) {
    52‚Üí      if (this.props.fallback) {
    53‚Üí        return this.props.fallback
    54‚Üí      }
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí      const isDevelopment = import.meta.env.DEV
    57‚Üí
    58‚Üí      return (
    59‚Üí        <Box
    60‚Üí          sx={{
    61‚Üí            display: 'flex',
    62‚Üí            alignItems: 'center',
    63‚Üí            justifyContent: 'center',
    64‚Üí            minHeight: '100vh',
    65‚Üí            bgcolor: 'background.default',
    66‚Üí          }}
    67‚Üí        >
    68‚Üí          <Container maxWidth="md">
    69‚Üí            <Alert severity="error" sx={{ mb: 3 }}>
    70‚Üí              <Typography variant="h6" gutterBottom>
    71‚Üí                Something went wrong
    72‚Üí              </Typography>
    73‚Üí              <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ mb: 2 }}>
    74‚Üí                An unexpected error occurred in the application. Please try reloading the page.
    75‚Üí              </Typography>
    76‚Üí              {isDevelopment && this.state.error && (
    77‚Üí                <Box sx={{ mt: 2 }}>
    78‚Üí                  <Typography variant="subtitle2" sx={{ fontWeight: 'bold', mb: 1 }}>
    79‚Üí                    Error Details (Development Only):
    80‚Üí                  </Typography>
    81‚Üí                  <Typography
    82‚Üí                    variant="body2"
    83‚Üí                    component="pre"
    84‚Üí                    sx={{
    85‚Üí                      p: 2,
    86‚Üí                      bgcolor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
    87‚Üí                      borderRadius: 1,
    88‚Üí                      overflow: 'auto',
    89‚Üí                      fontSize: '0.875rem',
    90‚Üí                      fontFamily: 'monospace',
    91‚Üí                    }}
    92‚Üí                  >
    93‚Üí                    {this.state.error.message}
    94‚Üí                  </Typography>
    95‚Üí                  {this.state.errorInfo?.componentStack && (
    96‚Üí                    <Typography
    97‚Üí                      variant="body2"
    98‚Üí                      component="pre"
    99‚Üí                      sx={{
   100‚Üí                        mt: 1,
   101‚Üí                        p: 2,
   102‚Üí                        bgcolor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
   103‚Üí                        borderRadius: 1,
   104‚Üí                        overflow: 'auto',
   105‚Üí                        fontSize: '0.75rem',
   106‚Üí                        fontFamily: 'monospace',
   107‚Üí                        maxHeight: '200px',
   108‚Üí                      }}
   109‚Üí                    >
   110‚Üí                      {this.state.errorInfo.componentStack}
   111‚Üí                    </Typography>
   112‚Üí                  )}
   113‚Üí                </Box>
   114‚Üí              )}
   115‚Üí              <Button
   116‚Üí                variant="contained"
   117‚Üí                color="primary"
   118‚Üí                onClick={this.handleReload}
   119‚Üí                sx={{ mt: 2 }}
   120‚Üí              >
   121‚Üí                Reload Page
   122‚Üí              </Button>
   123‚Üí            </Alert>
   124‚Üí          </Container>
   125‚Üí        </Box>
   126‚Üí      )
   127‚Üí    }

entries.detail:
1‚Üí# Add React Error Boundary for graceful crash recovery
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Overview
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíWrap the application's route tree in a React Error Boundary component that catches JavaScript runtime errors and displays a user-friendly fallback UI with a recovery action, instead of showing a blank white screen.
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí## Rationale
     8‚Üí
     9‚ÜíThe app has zero Error Boundary components (confirmed by searching for 'ErrorBoundary' across the entire frontend src). If any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing a property on undefined data, a rendering bug), React unmounts the entire component tree and the user sees a blank white page with no way to recover except a full browser refresh. For a construction operations platform used on job sites, this is especially problematic.
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí---
    12‚Üí*This spec was created from ideation and is pending detailed specification.*
    13‚Üí

     8‚Üíinterface ErrorBoundaryProps {

    12‚Üí
    13‚Üíinterface ErrorBoundaryState {

    17‚Üí}
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üíexport class ErrorBoundary extends Component<ErrorBoundaryProps, ErrorBoundaryState> {
    20‚Üí  constructor(props: ErrorBoundaryProps) {
    21‚Üí    super(props)
    22‚Üí    this.state = {
    23‚Üí      hasError: false,
    24‚Üí      error: null,
    25‚Üí      errorInfo: null,
    26‚Üí    }
    27‚Üí  }
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üí  static getDerivedStateFromError(error: Error): Partial<ErrorBoundaryState> {
    30‚Üí    return {
    31‚Üí      hasError: true,
    32‚Üí      error,
    33‚Üí    }
    34‚Üí  }
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí  componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: ErrorInfo): void {
    37‚Üí    this.setState({

    40‚Üí    })
    41‚Üí

#!/bin/bash

# Auto-Build Environment Setup
# Hebrew Translation Feature Implementation
# Generated by Planner Agent

set -e

echo "========================================"
echo "Starting Development Environment"
echo "Hebrew Translation Feature"
echo "========================================"

# Colors
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Wait for service function
wait_for_service() {
    local port=$1
    local name=$2
    local max=30
    local count=0

    echo "Waiting for $name on port $port..."
    while ! nc -z localhost $port 2>/dev/null; do
        count=$((count + 1))
        if [ $count -ge $max ]; then
            echo -e "${RED}$name failed to start${NC}"
            return 1
        fi
        sleep 1
    done
    echo -e "${GREEN}$name ready${NC}"
}

# ============================================
# START BACKEND SERVICE
# ============================================

echo ""
echo "Starting Backend (FastAPI)..."
cd ./backend

# Install dependencies if needed
if [ ! -d "venv" ]; then
    echo "Creating Python virtual environment..."
    python3 -m venv venv
fi

source venv/bin/activate

# Install/upgrade dependencies
pip install -q -r requirements.txt

# Run migrations
echo "Running database migrations..."
alembic upgrade head

# Start backend
echo "Backend starting on port 8000..."
uvicorn app.main:app --reload --port 8000 &
BACKEND_PID=$!

cd ..

# Wait for backend
wait_for_service 8000 "Backend API" || {
    kill $BACKEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    exit 1
}

# ============================================
# START FRONTEND SERVICE
# ============================================

echo ""
echo "Starting Frontend (React + Vite)..."
cd ./frontend

# Install dependencies if needed
if [ ! -d "node_modules" ]; then
    echo "Installing npm dependencies..."
    npm install
fi

# Start frontend
echo "Frontend starting on port 3000..."
npm run dev &
FRONTEND_PID=$!

cd ..

# Wait for frontend
wait_for_service 3000 "Frontend Application" || {
    kill $FRONTEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    kill $BACKEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    exit 1
}

# ============================================
# CLEANUP FUNCTION
# ============================================

cleanup() {
    echo ""
    echo "Shutting down services..."
    kill $BACKEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    kill $FRONTEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true
    echo "Done."
}

trap cleanup EXIT INT TERM

# ============================================
# SUMMARY
# ============================================

echo ""
echo "========================================"
echo -e "${GREEN}Environment Ready!${NC}"
echo "========================================"
echo ""
echo "Services:"
echo -e "  Backend:  ${GREEN}http://localhost:8000${NC}"
echo -e "    API:    ${GREEN}http://localhost:8000/api/v1${NC}"
echo -e "    Docs:   ${GREEN}http://localhost:8000/api/v1/docs${NC}"
echo -e "  Frontend: ${GREEN}http://localhost:3000${NC}"
echo ""
echo "Database:"
echo "  PostgreSQL is running (from docker-compose if started separately)"
echo ""
echo "Next Steps:"
echo "  1. Open http://localhost:3000 in your browser"
echo "  2. Try switching between English and Hebrew (language selector in header)"
echo "  3. Verify RTL layout works correctly in Hebrew mode"
echo "  4. Test API endpoints with curl or Postman"
echo ""
echo "Example: Test login with Hebrew language"
echo "  curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/auth/login \\"
echo "    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \\"
echo "    -H 'Accept-Language: he' \\"
echo "    -d '{\"email\": \"test@example.com\", \"password\": \"wrong\"}'"
echo ""
echo "Press Ctrl+C to stop all services"
echo ""

# Keep script running
wait $BACKEND_PID $FRONTEND_PID 2>/dev/null || true

1‚Üíimport { createContext, useContext, useState, useCallback, ReactNode } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport Snackbar from '@mui/material/Snackbar'
     3‚Üíimport Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üítype ToastSeverity = 'success' | 'error' | 'warning' | 'info'
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíinterface ToastContextType {
     8‚Üí  showToast: (message: string, severity?: ToastSeverity) => void
     9‚Üí  showError: (message: string) => void
    10‚Üí  showSuccess: (message: string) => void
    11‚Üí  showInfo: (message: string) => void
    12‚Üí  showWarning: (message: string) => void
    13‚Üí}
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíconst ToastContext = createContext<ToastContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üíexport function useToast() {
    18‚Üí  const context = useContext(ToastContext)
    19‚Üí  if (!context) {
    20‚Üí    throw new Error('useToast must be used within a ToastProvider')
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return context
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíinterface ToastProviderProps {
    26‚Üí  children: ReactNode
    27‚Üí}
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport function ToastProvider({ children }: ToastProviderProps) {
    30‚Üí  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false)
    31‚Üí  const [message, setMessage] = useState('')
    32‚Üí  const [severity, setSeverity] = useState<ToastSeverity>('info')
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí  const showToast = useCallback((msg: string, sev: ToastSeverity = 'info') => {
    35‚Üí    setMessage(msg)
    36‚Üí    setSeverity(sev)
    37‚Üí    setOpen(true)
    38‚Üí  }, [])
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí  const showError = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    41‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'error')
    42‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    43‚Üí
    44‚Üí  const showSuccess = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    45‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'success')
    46‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí  const showInfo = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    49‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'info')
    50‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí  const showWarning = useCallback((msg: string) => {
    53‚Üí    showToast(msg, 'warning')
    54‚Üí  }, [showToast])
    55‚Üí
    56‚Üí  const handleClose = () => {
    57‚Üí    setOpen(false)
    58‚Üí  }
    59‚Üí
    60‚Üí  return (
    61‚Üí    <ToastContext.Provider value={{ showToast, showError, showSuccess, showInfo, showWarning }}>
    62‚Üí      {children}
    63‚Üí      <Snackbar
    64‚Üí        open={open}

1‚Üíimport React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, useMemo } from 'react'
     2‚Üíimport { ThemeProvider as MuiThemeProvider } from '@mui/material/styles'
     3‚Üíimport CssBaseline from '@mui/material/CssBaseline'
     4‚Üíimport { createLightTheme, createDarkTheme } from './theme'
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üítype ThemeMode = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system'
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üíinterface ThemeContextType {
     9‚Üí  mode: ThemeMode
    10‚Üí  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void
    11‚Üí  isDark: boolean
    12‚Üí  toggleTheme: () => void
    13‚Üí}
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üíconst ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined)
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üíexport function useThemeMode() {
    18‚Üí  const context = useContext(ThemeContext)
    19‚Üí  if (!context) {
    20‚Üí    throw new Error('useThemeMode must be used within ThemeProvider')
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  return context
    23‚Üí}
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üíinterface ThemeProviderProps {
    26‚Üí  children: React.ReactNode
    27‚Üí}
    28‚Üí
    29‚Üíexport function ThemeProvider({ children }: ThemeProviderProps) {
    30‚Üí  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>(() => {
    31‚Üí    const stored = localStorage.getItem('theme-mode')
    32‚Üí    return (stored as ThemeMode) || 'system'
    33‚Üí  })
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí  const [systemPrefersDark, setSystemPrefersDark] = useState(() =>
    36‚Üí    window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)').matches
    37‚Üí  )
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    40‚Üí    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)')
    41‚Üí    const handler = (e: MediaQueryListEvent) => setSystemPrefersDark(e.matches)
    42‚Üí    mediaQuery.addEventListener('change', handler)
    43‚Üí    return () => mediaQuery.removeEventListener('change', handler)
    44‚Üí  }, [])
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí  useEffect(() => {
    47‚Üí    localStorage.setItem('theme-mode', mode)
    48‚Üí  }, [mode])
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí  const isDark = useMemo(() => {
    51‚Üí    if (mode === 'system') return systemPrefersDark
    52‚Üí    return mode === 'dark'
    53‚Üí  }, [mode, systemPrefersDark])
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí  const theme = useMemo(() => {
    56‚Üí    return isDark ? createDarkTheme() : createLightTheme()
    57‚Üí  }, [isDark])
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí  const toggleTheme = () => {
    60‚Üí    setMode(prev => {
    61‚Üí      if (prev === 'light') return 'dark'
    62‚Üí      if (prev === 'dark') return 'light'
    63‚Üí      return isDark ? 'light' : 'dark'
    64‚Üí    })
    65‚Üí  }
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí  const value = useMemo(() => ({
    68‚Üí    mode,
    69‚Üí    setMode,
    70‚Üí    isDark,
    71‚Üí    toggleTheme,
    72‚Üí  }), [mode, isDark])
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí  return (
    75‚Üí    <ThemeContext.Provider value={value}>
    76‚Üí      <MuiThemeProvider theme={theme}>
    77‚Üí        <CssBaseline />
    78‚Üí        {children}
    79‚Üí      </MuiThemeProvider>
    80‚Üí    </ThemeContext.Provider>
    81‚Üí  )
    82‚Üí}

@@ -0,0 +1,131 @@
+import React, { Component, ErrorInfo, ReactNode } from 'react'
+import Box from '@mui/material/Box'
+import Container from '@mui/material/Container'
+import Alert from '@mui/material/Alert'
+import Typography from '@mui/material/Typography'
+import Button from '@mui/material/Button'
+
+interface ErrorBoundaryProps {
+  children: ReactNode
+  fallback?: ReactNode
+}
+
+interface ErrorBoundaryState {
+  hasError: boolean
+  error: Error | null
+  errorInfo: ErrorInfo | null
+}
+
+export class ErrorBoundary extends Component<ErrorBoundaryProps, ErrorBoundaryState> {
+  constructor(props: ErrorBoundaryProps) {
+    super(props)
+    this.state = {
+      hasError: false,
+      error: null,
+      errorInfo: null,
+    }
+  }
+
+  static getDerivedStateFromError(error: Error): Partial<ErrorBoundaryState> {
+    return {
+      hasError: true,
+      error,
+    }
+  }
+
+  componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: ErrorInfo): void {
+    this.setState({
+      error,
+      errorInfo,
+    })
+
+    // Log error to console for debugging
+    console.error('ErrorBoundary caught an error:', error, errorInfo)
+  }
+
+  handleReload = (): void => {
+    window.location.reload()
+  }
+
+  render(): ReactNode {
+    if (this.state.hasError) {
+      if (this.props.fallback) {
+        return this.props.fallback
+      }
+
+      const isDevelopment = import.meta.env.DEV
+
+      return (
+        <Box
+          sx={{
+            display: 'flex',
+            alignItems: 'center',
+            justifyContent: 'center',
+            minHeight: '100vh',
+            bgcolor: 'background.default',
+          }}
+        >
+          <Container maxWidth="md">
+            <Alert severity="error" sx={{ mb: 3 }}>
+              <Typography variant="h6" gutterBottom>
+                Something went wrong
+              </Typography>
+              <Typography variant="body2" sx={{ mb: 2 }}>
+                An unexpected error occurred in the application. Please try reloading the page.
+              </Typography>
+              {isDevelopment && this.state.error && (
+                <Box sx={{ mt: 2 }}>
+                  <Typography variant="subtitle2" sx={{ fontWeight: 'bold', mb: 1 }}>
+                    Error Details (Development Only):
+                  </Typography>
+                  <Typography
+                    variant="body2"
+                    component="pre"
+                    sx={{
+                      p: 2,
+                      bgcolor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
+                      borderRadius: 1,
+                      overflow: 'auto',
+                      fontSize: '0.875rem',
+                      fontFamily: 'monospace',
+                    }}
+                  >
+                    {this.state.error.message}
+                  </Typography>
+                  {this.state.errorInfo?.componentStack && (
+                    <Typography
+                      variant="body2"
+                      component="pre"
+                      sx={{
+                        mt: 1,
+                        p: 2,
+                        bgcolor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)',
+                        borderRadius: 1,
+                        overflow: 'auto',
+                        fontSize: '0.75rem',
+                        fontFamily: 'monospace',
+                        maxHeight: '200px',
+                      }}
+                    >
+                      {this.state.errorInfo.componentStack}
+                    </Typography>
+                  )}
+                </Box>
+              )}
+              <Button
+                variant="contained"
+                color="primary"
+                onClick={this.handleReload}
+                sx={{ mt: 2 }}
+              >
+                Reload Page
+              </Button>
+            </Alert>
+          </Container>
+        </Box>
+      )
+    }
+
+    return this.props.children
+  }
+}
